channel.title: Owner ____ has logged in
channel.description: Alright, on my server I have it where (player rights == 3) Co-owner ____ has logged in... But, how do I make a code where I want it to say Owner _____ has logged in? (Note: I want it for my name only to say Owner has logged in.)

item.title: Owner ____ has logged in
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

[quote=“chassy13, post:8, topic:258125”]if(playerRights == 3 && !playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("NAME HERE")) { PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "Co-Owner "+playerName+" has logged in!"; } else { PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "Owner "+playerName+" has logged in!"; }

Try that. Post any errors.[/quote]
That will call them an owner if their playerRights are less than 3 if I’m not mistaken.
Try this:

String prefix = "";
if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("NAME HERE"))
{
    prefix = "Owner ";
}
else
{
    switch(playerRights)
    {
        case 1:
            prefix = "Moderator ";
        break;
        case 2:
            prefix = "Administrator ";
        break;
        case 3:
            prefix = "Co-owner ";
        break;
    }
}
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = prefix+playerName+" has just logged in.";

Edit: There, it tells you if they’re a moderator or administrator as well.

Read full topic

Try that. Post any errors.
